- The rates of the forward and backward reactions must be equal.

correct_answer:
(a) Graphite:-hexagonal: Diamond:-letrahedral/octahedral
(ii) Explain briefly why diamond is hard and a non-conductor of electricity while graphite is soft and an electrical conductor: n diamond each carbon atom is covalently bonded to four other carbon atoms forming an interlocking three dimens1onal network hence the hardness. Each of the four valence electrons is localized in a covalent bond hence there are no free mobile electrons, while in graphite each carbon atom is bonded to three other carbon atoms forming large sheets with van der Waal's force between the sheets which can easily slide over one another. One of the valence electrons of each atom is delocalized in a covalent bond and can act as a conductor of electricity OR Diamond is hard because it has a rigid/three-dimensional structure. It has no free/ mobile electrons hence it does not conduct electricity. Graphite has a layered structure held together by weak van der Waal's forces hence it is soft. It conducts electricity because it has free/ mobile electrons.
